commits.message: Fix sampling of metallic/roughness map. PBR shader working!
Switch to cgltf for gltf loading

pull_request.title: docs: Fix a few typos
pull_request.body:
There are small typos in:
- src/game/events.h
- src/game/game.c
- src/game/renderer.h

Fixes:
- Should read `entity` rather than `entitiy`.
- Should read `conditionally` rather than `condionally`.

issue.body:

- src/game/game.c

comment.body: Thanks for putting this together, but as mentioned in the README, I’m not accepting outside contributions on this project.

issue.title: Not checking the 'dead' entity flag while iterating over entities.
issue.body:
As far as I understand, dead entities are only filtered before calling the drawing/rendering functions. While iterating over entities we don't seem to be skipping those with their `->dead[i]` flag set. I am not sure if that's correct though.

In the function `src/game/game.c/mainGame` we call `simWorld`, which checks for collisions between player bullets and enemies (i.e it sets the `->dead[i]` flag), later 'mainGame' also calls `simPlayer` which checks for collisions between the player and the enemies using the `checkPlayerCollision` function. But the `checkPlayerCollision` function doesn't skip "dead" enemies, which makes it possible for "dead" enemies to collide with the player.

issue.title: Not checking the 'dead' entity flag while iterating over entities.
issue.body:
As far as I understand, dead entities are only filtered before calling the drawing/rendering functions. While iterating over entities we don't seem to be skipping those with their `->dead[i]` flag set. I am not sure if that's correct though.

In the function `src/game/game.c/mainGame` we call `simWorld`, which checks for collisions between player bullets and enemies (i.e it sets the `->dead[i]` flag), later 'mainGame' also calls `simPlayer` which checks for collisions between the player and the enemies using the `checkPlayerCollision` function. But the `checkPlayerCollision` function doesn't skip "dead" enemies, which makes it possible for "dead" enemies to collide with the player.

comment.body: Hi! Thanks for looking into this, and sorry for the late reply. This is intentional. Essentially the way of thinking about the batch updates is that entities are considered “alive” for the entirety of the step they’re being processed in. They aren’t really dead until they’re filtered out of the entity array at the end of the step. The `dead` flag can be thought of as `willBeDeadOnNextStep`. If I allowed entities to die mid-step, there would be an order-dependence on the collision tests, i.e. checking player/enemy collisions first vs. bullet/enemy collisions first would result in different behavior.

commits.message: Add runtime checks to windows debug build
Options to customize title screen for web
Option to init game without music
Update bmp loading API to match wav loading
Fix bug where input to start game was missed.
Audio data managed in audio platform layer
Fix sampling of metallic/roughness map. PBR shader working!
Switch to cgltf for gltf loading

comment.body: Hi! Thanks for looking into this, and sorry for the late reply. This is intentional. Essentially the way of thinking about the batch updates is that entities are considered “alive” for the entirety of the step they’re being processed in. If I allowed entities to die mid-step, there would be an order-dependence on the collision tests, i.e. checking player/enemy collisions first vs. bullet/enemy collisions first would result in different behavior.
